trans-unit.source: Linux Agent User Guide for Azure
trans-unit.target: Linux Agent User Guide for Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to install and configure Linux Agent (waagent) to manage your virtual machine's interaction with Azure Fabric Controller.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to install and configure Linux Agent (waagent) to manage your virtual machine's interaction with Azure Fabric Controller.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Linux Agent (/usr/sbin/waagent) manages interaction between a virtual machine and the Azure Fabric Controller.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Linux Agent (/usr/sbin/waagent) manages interaction between a virtual machine and the Azure Fabric Controller.

trans-unit.source: Deploy SSH public keys and key pairs
trans-unit.target: Deploy SSH public keys and key pairs

trans-unit.source: Publishes the host name to the platform DNS
trans-unit.target: Publishes the host name to the platform DNS

trans-unit.source: Reports SSH host key fingerprint to the platform
trans-unit.target: Reports SSH host key fingerprint to the platform

trans-unit.source: Formats and mounts the resource disk
trans-unit.target: Formats and mounts the resource disk

trans-unit.source: Manages routes to improve compatibility with platform DHCP servers
trans-unit.target: Manages routes to improve compatibility with platform DHCP servers

trans-unit.source: Ensures the stability of the network interface name
trans-unit.target: Ensures the stability of the network interface name

trans-unit.source: Configures SCSI timeouts for the root device (which could be remote)
trans-unit.target: Configures SCSI timeouts for the root device (which could be remote)

trans-unit.source: Redirects the console to the serial port
trans-unit.target: Redirects the console to the serial port

trans-unit.source: Detects and bootstraps the VMM agent for Linux when running in a System Center Virtual Machine Manager 2012 R2 environment
trans-unit.target: Detects and bootstraps the VMM agent for Linux when running in a System Center Virtual Machine Manager 2012 R2 environment

trans-unit.source: Inject component authored by Microsoft and Partners into Linux VM (IaaS) to enable software and configuration automation
trans-unit.target: Inject component authored by Microsoft and Partners into Linux VM (IaaS) to enable software and configuration automation

trans-unit.source: The information flow from the platform to the agent occurs via two channels:
trans-unit.target: The information flow from the platform to the agent occurs via two channels:

trans-unit.source: A boot-time attached DVD for IaaS deployments.
trans-unit.target: A boot-time attached DVD for IaaS deployments.

trans-unit.source: This DVD includes an OVF-compliant configuration file that includes all provisioning information other than the actual SSH keypairs.
trans-unit.target: This DVD includes an OVF-compliant configuration file that includes all provisioning information other than the actual SSH keypairs.

trans-unit.source: A TCP endpoint exposing a REST API used to obtain deployment and topology configuration.
trans-unit.target: A TCP endpoint exposing a REST API used to obtain deployment and topology configuration.

trans-unit.source: You can get the Latest Linux Agent directly from:
trans-unit.target: You can get the Latest Linux Agent directly from:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>The different Distribution providers endorsing Linux on Azure</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>The different Distribution providers endorsing Linux on Azure</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: or from the <link><linkText>GitHub Open Source Repository for the Azure Linux Agent</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: or from the <link><linkText>GitHub Open Source Repository for the Azure Linux Agent</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: The following systems have been tested and are known to work with the Azure Linux Agent.
trans-unit.target: The following systems have been tested and are known to work with the Azure Linux Agent.

trans-unit.source: Please note that this list may differ from the official list of supported systems on the Microsoft Azure Platform, as described here:
trans-unit.target: Please note that this list may differ from the official list of supported systems on the Microsoft Azure Platform, as described here:

trans-unit.source: The Linux agent depends on some system packages in order to function properly:
trans-unit.target: The Linux agent depends on some system packages in order to function properly:

trans-unit.source: Filesystem utilities: sfdisk, fdisk, mkfs, parted
trans-unit.target: Filesystem utilities: sfdisk, fdisk, mkfs, parted

trans-unit.source: Installation using an RPM or a DEB package from your distribution's package repository is the preferred method of installing and upgrading the Azure Linux Agent.
trans-unit.target: Installation using an RPM or a DEB package from your distribution's package repository is the preferred method of installing and upgrading the Azure Linux Agent.

trans-unit.source: If installing manually, the 'waagent' script should be copied to /usr/sbin/waagent and installed by running:
trans-unit.target: If installing manually, the 'waagent' script should be copied to /usr/sbin/waagent and installed by running:

trans-unit.source: The agent's log file is kept at /var/log/waagent.log.
trans-unit.target: The agent's log file is kept at /var/log/waagent.log.

trans-unit.source: verbose: Increase verbosity of specified command
trans-unit.target: verbose: Increase verbosity of specified command

trans-unit.source: force: Skip interactive confirmation for some commands
trans-unit.target: force: Skip interactive confirmation for some commands

trans-unit.source: help: Lists the supported commands and flags.
trans-unit.target: help: Lists the supported commands and flags.

trans-unit.source: install: Manual installation of the agent
trans-unit.target: install: Manual installation of the agent

trans-unit.source: Checks the system for required dependencies
trans-unit.target: Checks the system for required dependencies

trans-unit.source: Creates the SysV init script (/etc/init.d/waagent), the logrotate configuration file (/etc/logrotate.d/waagent and configures the image to run the init script on boot
trans-unit.target: Creates the SysV init script (/etc/init.d/waagent), the logrotate configuration file (/etc/logrotate.d/waagent and configures the image to run the init script on boot

trans-unit.source: Any existing configuration file is moved to /etc/waagent.conf.old
trans-unit.target: Any existing configuration file is moved to /etc/waagent.conf.old

trans-unit.source: Detects kernel version and applies the VNUMA workaround if necessary
trans-unit.target: Detects kernel version and applies the VNUMA workaround if necessary

trans-unit.source: Moves udev rules that may interfere with networking (/lib/udev/rules.d/75-persistent-net-generator.rules, /etc/udev/rules.d/70-persistent-net.rules) to /var/lib/waagent/
trans-unit.target: Moves udev rules that may interfere with networking (/lib/udev/rules.d/75-persistent-net-generator.rules, /etc/udev/rules.d/70-persistent-net.rules) to /var/lib/waagent/

trans-unit.source: uninstall: Remove waagent and associated files
trans-unit.target: uninstall: Remove waagent and associated files

trans-unit.source: Unregisters the init script from the system and deletes it
trans-unit.target: Unregisters the init script from the system and deletes it

trans-unit.source: Deletes the logrotate configuration and the waagent config file in /etc/waagent.conf
trans-unit.target: Deletes the logrotate configuration and the waagent config file in /etc/waagent.conf

trans-unit.source: Restores any moved udev rules that were moved during installation
trans-unit.target: Restores any moved udev rules that were moved during installation

trans-unit.source: Automatic reverting of the VNUMA workaround is not supported, please edit the GRUB configuration files by hand to re-enable NUMA if required.
trans-unit.target: Automatic reverting of the VNUMA workaround is not supported, please edit the GRUB configuration files by hand to re-enable NUMA if required.

trans-unit.source: deprovision: Attempt to clean the system and make it suitable for re-provisioning.
trans-unit.target: deprovision: Attempt to clean the system and make it suitable for re-provisioning.

trans-unit.source: All SSH host keys (if Provisioning.RegenerateSshHostKeyPair is 'y' in the configuration file)
trans-unit.target: All SSH host keys (if Provisioning.RegenerateSshHostKeyPair is 'y' in the configuration file)

trans-unit.source: Root password from /etc/shadow (if Provisioning.DeleteRootPassword is 'y' in the configuration file)
trans-unit.target: Root password from /etc/shadow (if Provisioning.DeleteRootPassword is 'y' in the configuration file)

trans-unit.source: Warning:* Deprovision does not guarantee that the image is cleared of all sensitive information and suitable for redistribution.
trans-unit.target: Warning:* Deprovision does not guarantee that the image is cleared of all sensitive information and suitable for redistribution.

trans-unit.source: deprovision+user: Performs everything under -deprovision (above) and also deletes the last provisioned user account (obtained from /var/lib/waagent) and associated data.
trans-unit.target: deprovision+user: Performs everything under -deprovision (above) and also deletes the last provisioned user account (obtained from /var/lib/waagent) and associated data.

trans-unit.source: This parameter is when de-provisioning an image that was previously provisioning on Azure so it may be captured and re-used.
trans-unit.target: This parameter is when de-provisioning an image that was previously provisioning on Azure so it may be captured and re-used.

trans-unit.source: version: Displays the version of waagent
trans-unit.target: version: Displays the version of waagent

trans-unit.source: serialconsole: Configures GRUB to mark ttyS0 (the first serial port) as
trans-unit.target: serialconsole: Configures GRUB to mark ttyS0 (the first serial port) as

trans-unit.source: This ensures that kernel bootup logs are sent to the
trans-unit.target: This ensures that kernel bootup logs are sent to the

trans-unit.source: serial port and made available for debugging.
trans-unit.target: serial port and made available for debugging.

trans-unit.source: daemon: Run waagent as a daemon to manage interaction with the platform.
trans-unit.target: daemon: Run waagent as a daemon to manage interaction with the platform.

trans-unit.source: This argument is specified to waagent in the waagent init script.
trans-unit.target: This argument is specified to waagent in the waagent init script.

trans-unit.source: A configuration file (/etc/waagent.conf) controls the actions of waagent.
trans-unit.target: A configuration file (/etc/waagent.conf) controls the actions of waagent.

trans-unit.source: A sample configuration file is shown below:
trans-unit.target: A sample configuration file is shown below:

trans-unit.source: The various configuration options are described in detail below.
trans-unit.target: The various configuration options are described in detail below.

trans-unit.source: Configuration options are of three types; Boolean, String or Integer.
trans-unit.target: Configuration options are of three types; Boolean, String or Integer.

trans-unit.source: The Boolean configuration options can be specified as "y" or "n".
trans-unit.target: The Boolean configuration options can be specified as "y" or "n".

trans-unit.source: The special keyword "None" may be used for some string type configuration entries as detailed below.
trans-unit.target: The special keyword "None" may be used for some string type configuration entries as detailed below.

trans-unit.source: If a path to an executable program is specified, it is invoked when waagent has provisioned the image and the "Ready" state is about to be reported to the Fabric.
trans-unit.target: If a path to an executable program is specified, it is invoked when waagent has provisioned the image and the "Ready" state is about to be reported to the Fabric.

trans-unit.source: The argument specified to the program will be "Ready".
trans-unit.target: The argument specified to the program will be "Ready".

trans-unit.source: The agent will not wait for the program to return before continuing.
trans-unit.target: The agent will not wait for the program to return before continuing.

trans-unit.source: If a path to an executable program is specified, the program is invoked when the Fabric indicates that a configuration file is available for the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: If a path to an executable program is specified, the program is invoked when the Fabric indicates that a configuration file is available for the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The path to the XML configuration file is provided as an argument to the executable.
trans-unit.target: The path to the XML configuration file is provided as an argument to the executable.

trans-unit.source: This may be invoked multiple times whenever the configuration file changes.
trans-unit.target: This may be invoked multiple times whenever the configuration file changes.

trans-unit.source: A sample file is provided in the Appendix.
trans-unit.target: A sample file is provided in the Appendix.

trans-unit.source: The current path of this file is /var/lib/waagent/HostingEnvironmentConfig.xml.
trans-unit.target: The current path of this file is /var/lib/waagent/HostingEnvironmentConfig.xml.

trans-unit.source: If a path to an executable program is specified, the program is invoked when the Fabric indicates that a new network topology layout is available for the virtual machine.The path to the XML configuration file is provided as an argument to the executable.
trans-unit.target: If a path to an executable program is specified, the program is invoked when the Fabric indicates that a new network topology layout is available for the virtual machine.The path to the XML configuration file is provided as an argument to the executable.

trans-unit.source: This may be invoked multiple times whenever the network topology changes (due to service healing for example).
trans-unit.target: This may be invoked multiple times whenever the network topology changes (due to service healing for example).

trans-unit.source: A sample file is provided in the Appendix.
trans-unit.target: A sample file is provided in the Appendix.

trans-unit.source: The current location of this file is /var/lib/waagent/SharedConfig.xml.
trans-unit.target: The current location of this file is /var/lib/waagent/SharedConfig.xml.

trans-unit.source: This allows the user to enable or disable the provisioning functionality in the agent.
trans-unit.target: This allows the user to enable or disable the provisioning functionality in the agent.

trans-unit.source: If provisioning is disabled, SSH host and user keys in the image are preserved and any configuration specified in the Azure provisioning API is ignored.
trans-unit.target: If provisioning is disabled, SSH host and user keys in the image are preserved and any configuration specified in the Azure provisioning API is ignored.

trans-unit.source: Note: this parameter defaults to "n" on Ubuntu Cloud Images that use cloud-init for provisioning.
trans-unit.target: Note: this parameter defaults to "n" on Ubuntu Cloud Images that use cloud-init for provisioning.

trans-unit.source: If set, the root password in the /etc/shadow file is erased during the provisioning process.
trans-unit.target: If set, the root password in the /etc/shadow file is erased during the provisioning process.

trans-unit.source: If set, all SSH host key pairs (ecdsa, dsa and rsa) are deleted during the provisioning process from /etc/ssh/.
trans-unit.target: If set, all SSH host key pairs (ecdsa, dsa and rsa) are deleted during the provisioning process from /etc/ssh/.

trans-unit.source: And a single fresh key pair is generated.
trans-unit.target: And a single fresh key pair is generated.

trans-unit.source: The encryption type for the fresh key pair is configurable by the Provisioning.SshHostKeyPairType entry.
trans-unit.target: The encryption type for the fresh key pair is configurable by the Provisioning.SshHostKeyPairType entry.

trans-unit.source: Please note that some distributions will re-create SSH key pairs for any missing encryption types when the SSH daemon is restarted (for example, upon a reboot).
trans-unit.target: Please note that some distributions will re-create SSH key pairs for any missing encryption types when the SSH daemon is restarted (for example, upon a reboot).

trans-unit.source: This can be set to an encryption algorithm type that is supported by the SSH daemon on the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: This can be set to an encryption algorithm type that is supported by the SSH daemon on the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The typically supported values are "rsa", "dsa" and "ecdsa".
trans-unit.target: The typically supported values are "rsa", "dsa" and "ecdsa".

trans-unit.source: Note that "putty.exe" on Windows does not support "ecdsa".
trans-unit.target: Note that "putty.exe" on Windows does not support "ecdsa".

trans-unit.source: So, if you intend to use putty.exe on Windows to connect to a Linux deployment, please use "rsa" or "dsa".
trans-unit.target: So, if you intend to use putty.exe on Windows to connect to a Linux deployment, please use "rsa" or "dsa".

trans-unit.source: If set, waagent will monitor the Linux virtual machine for hostname changes (as returned by the "hostname" command) and automatically update the networking configuration in the image to reflect the change.
trans-unit.target: If set, waagent will monitor the Linux virtual machine for hostname changes (as returned by the "hostname" command) and automatically update the networking configuration in the image to reflect the change.

trans-unit.source: In order to push the name change to the DNS servers, networking will be restarted in the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: In order to push the name change to the DNS servers, networking will be restarted in the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: This will result in brief loss of Internet connectivity.
trans-unit.target: This will result in brief loss of Internet connectivity.

trans-unit.source: If set, the resource disk provided by the platform will be formatted and mounted by waagent if the filesystem type requested by the user in "ResourceDisk.Filesystem" is anything other than "ntfs".
trans-unit.target: If set, the resource disk provided by the platform will be formatted and mounted by waagent if the filesystem type requested by the user in "ResourceDisk.Filesystem" is anything other than "ntfs".

trans-unit.source: A single partition of type Linux (83) will be made available on the disk.
trans-unit.target: A single partition of type Linux (83) will be made available on the disk.

trans-unit.source: Note that this partition will not be formatted if it can be successfully mounted.
trans-unit.target: Note that this partition will not be formatted if it can be successfully mounted.

trans-unit.source: This specifies the filesystem type for the resource disk.
trans-unit.target: This specifies the filesystem type for the resource disk.

trans-unit.source: Supported values vary by Linux distribution.
trans-unit.target: Supported values vary by Linux distribution.

trans-unit.source: If the string is X, then mkfs.X should be present on the Linux image.
trans-unit.target: If the string is X, then mkfs.X should be present on the Linux image.

trans-unit.source: This specifies the path at which the resource disk is mounted.
trans-unit.target: This specifies the path at which the resource disk is mounted.

trans-unit.source: Note that the resource disk is a temporary disk, and might be emptied when the VM is deprovisioned.
trans-unit.target: Note that the resource disk is a temporary disk, and might be emptied when the VM is deprovisioned.

trans-unit.source: If set, a swap file (/swapfile) is created on the resource disk and added to the system swap space.
trans-unit.target: If set, a swap file (/swapfile) is created on the resource disk and added to the system swap space.

trans-unit.source: The size of the swap file in megabytes.
trans-unit.target: The size of the swap file in megabytes.

trans-unit.source: If set, waagent will respond to load balancer probes from the platform (if present).
trans-unit.target: If set, waagent will respond to load balancer probes from the platform (if present).

trans-unit.source: If set, log verbosity is boosted.
trans-unit.target: If set, log verbosity is boosted.

trans-unit.source: Waagent logs to /var/log/waagent.log and leverages the system logrotate functionality to rotate logs.
trans-unit.target: Waagent logs to /var/log/waagent.log and leverages the system logrotate functionality to rotate logs.

trans-unit.source: This configures the SCSI timeout in seconds on the OS disk and data drives.
trans-unit.target: This configures the SCSI timeout in seconds on the OS disk and data drives.

trans-unit.source: If not set, the system defaults are used.
trans-unit.target: If not set, the system defaults are used.

trans-unit.source: This can be used to specify an alternate path for the openssl binary to use for cryptographic operations.
trans-unit.target: This can be used to specify an alternate path for the openssl binary to use for cryptographic operations.

trans-unit.source: Note that Ubuntu Cloud Images utilize <link><linkText>cloud-init</linkText><title></title></link> to perform many configuration tasks that would otherwise be managed by the Azure Linux Agent.
trans-unit.target: Note that Ubuntu Cloud Images utilize <link><linkText>cloud-init</linkText><title></title></link> to perform many configuration tasks that would otherwise be managed by the Azure Linux Agent.

trans-unit.source: Provisioning.Enabled defaults to "n" on Ubuntu Cloud Images that use cloud-init to perform provisioning tasks.
trans-unit.target: Provisioning.Enabled defaults to "n" on Ubuntu Cloud Images that use cloud-init to perform provisioning tasks.

trans-unit.source: The following configuration parameters have no effect on Ubuntu Cloud Images that use cloud-init to manage the resource disk and swap space:
trans-unit.target: The following configuration parameters have no effect on Ubuntu Cloud Images that use cloud-init to manage the resource disk and swap space:

trans-unit.source: Please see the following resources to configure the resource disk mount point and swap space on Ubuntu Cloud Images during provisioning:
trans-unit.target: Please see the following resources to configure the resource disk mount point and swap space on Ubuntu Cloud Images during provisioning:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Injecting Custom Data into an Azure Virtual Machine</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Injecting Custom Data into an Azure Virtual Machine</linkText><title></title></link>
